## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
library(tidyverse)
library(ratdat)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
ggplot(data = complete_old, aes(x = weight, y = hindfoot_length)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.2, color = "blue")

ggplot(data = complete_old, aes(x = weight, y = hindfoot_length, color = plot_type)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.2) +
  scale_color_viridis_d()

ggplot(data = complete_old, aes(x = weight, y = hindfoot_length, color = plot_type)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.2) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  scale_y_log10()
```
```{r}
ggplot(data = complete_old, aes(x = plot_type, y = hindfoot_length, fill = plot_type)) +
  geom_point(size = .1) +
  geom_jitter(aes(color = plot_type), alpha = .2) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = label_wrap_gen(width = 10)) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 14), legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "Rodent size by plot type", x = "Plot Type", y = "Hindfoot Length (mm)") +
  facet_wrap(vars(sex), nrow = 1)
```

```{r}

species_count <- complete_old |> group_by(species) |> summarize(count = n()) |> arrange(desc(count)) |> slice(1:5)


ggplot(data = complete_old, aes(x = plot_type, y = hindfoot_length, fill = plot_type)) +
  geom_point(size = .1) +
  geom_jitter(aes(color = plot_type), alpha = .2) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = label_wrap_gen(width = 10)) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 14), legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "Rodent size by plot type", x = "Plot Type", y = "Hindfoot Length (mm)") +
  facet_grid(rows = vars(sex), cols = vars(species))
```
```{r}
complete_old |> filter(species %in% species_count$species) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = plot_type, y = hindfoot_length, fill = plot_type)) +
  geom_point(size = .1) +
  geom_jitter(aes(color = plot_type), alpha = .2) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = label_wrap_gen(width = 10)) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.title = element_text(size = 14), legend.position = "none") +
  labs(title = "Rodent size by plot type", x = "Plot Type", y = "Hindfoot Length (mm)") +
  facet_grid(rows = vars(sex), cols = vars(species))
```
